article: This is no joke. Kelly Katrina Hildebrandt, 20, and Kelly Carl Hildebrandt, 24, are expecting just over 100 guests at a(an) _ at a church, where they will become husband and wife. At the time, Kelly Hildebrandt, of Lubbock, Texas, was the only one matched. So she sent him a _ . She said, "Hi. We had the same name. Thought it was cool." Kelly Carl Hildebrandt said, "I thought she was pretty _ ." For the next three months the two _ e-mails. _ he knew it, occasional phone calls turned into daily chats, sometimes _ hours. He _ her in Florida after a few months and fell head over heels. "I thought it was fun," he said of that first online meet. "I had no _ that it would lead to this." Months after Kelly Hildebrandt sent her first e-mail, she found a diamond engagement _ hidden in treasure box on a beach in December. "I totally think that it's all God's _ ," Kelly Katrina Hildebrandt said. "He planned it out just _ ." She's a student at a local community college. He works in financial _ . They plan to make their home in South Florida. There was also some uncertainty _ how to phrase their wedding invitations, so they decided to include their _ names. But _ confusion likely won't carry on past the husband and wife, as Kelly Katrina Hildebrandt said there are no plans to pass along the name to their future _ . "No," she said.
